abstract.p: Authorities expand investigation of Michael Devlin, who is accused of kidnapping Shawn Hornbeck and William Ownby, to include search of one of his previous apartments in Kirkwood, Mo; Livingston County, Ill, sheriff is investigating whether he could be implicated in 2003 unsolved murder of another child (M)

block.p: The authorities said Wednesday that they had expanded the investigation of a man accused of kidnapping two boys, to include a search of one of his previous apartments, as well as looking into whether he may have had a connection to an unsolved Illinois killing in 2003.

The man, Michael Devlin, 41, of Kirkwood, Mo., a St. Louis suburb, is charged in the abductions of Shawn Hornbeck, 15, and William Ownby, 13, who were found Jan. 12 in a search of Mr. Devlin's apartment.

The authorities said Wednesday that they had expanded the investigation of a man accused of kidnapping two boys, to include a search of one of his previous apartments, as well as looking into whether he may have had a connection to an unsolved Illinois killing in 2003.

The man, Michael Devlin, 41, of Kirkwood, Mo., a St. Louis suburb, is charged in the abductions of Shawn Hornbeck, 15, and William Ownby, 13, who were found Jan. 12 in a search of Mr. Devlin's apartment.

Across the Mississippi River in Illinois, the Livingston County sheriff, Robert McCarty, said his deputies were investigating whether Mr. Devlin could be linked to the 2003 killing of 7-year-old Dalton Mesarchik.

''I don't know if we're at the point where we'd consider him a person of interest,'' the sheriff said of Mr. Devlin. ''We're not even saying there is a connection, but we do have an interest in making sure there's nothing that would place him in Livingston County around the time of Dalton's death.''
In Kirkwood, a police officer who said he was not authorized to speak publicly said the search of Mr. Devlin's former apartment was part of a ''routine investigation.''
The Washington County prosecutor, John Rupp, said Mr. Devlin had waived his right to a formal arraignment, opting that a not-guilty plea be entered on his behalf.
A former pizzeria manager, Mr. Devlin has been charged with kidnapping and armed criminal action in the 2002 abduction of the Hornbeck boy.
The authorities said Mr. Devlin had brandished a gun when he abducted Shawn, then 11, near the boy's home in Richwoods, Mo.

In neighboring Franklin County, Mr. Devlin has pleaded not guilty to one count of kidnapping in the Ownby abduction. The boy, known as Ben, disappeared Jan. 8 from an area near his home in Beaufort, Mo.
